body: That's expected. See #11789. Do you need it to return output once it's been set in your environment?

Your recommendation was to include:
`eval $(/opt/homebrew/bin/brew shellenv)` in `.zprofile`

(https://github.com/Homebrew/discussions/discussions/938#discussioncomment-407419)

Has this changed?

Why include the eval?  Is brew shellenv supposed to output something?

My `$PATH` variable used to be altered.  And now it is no longer being altered to include /opt/homebrew/bin and /opt/homebrew/sbin.

What's the output of
```
unset HOMEBREW_SHELLENV_PREFIX
/opt/homebrew/bin/brew shellenv
```
?

This is behaving as expected then. `/opt/homebrew/bin/brew shellenv` is only meant to be run once. It should also have run successfully since you have `HOMEBREW_SHELLENV_PREFIX` set in your environment.

I don't know why this is happening:

> My `$PATH` variable used to be altered. And now it is no longer being altered to include /opt/homebrew/bin and /opt/homebrew/sbin.

But it's relatively clear that it's not because of `brew shellenv`. There is something else going on in your config that's causing this.

I think the order has changed in when the PATH was being set in my config or else `brew shellenv` used to always output these exports.

I will include `unset HOMEBREW_SHELLENV_PREFIX && opt/homebrew/bin/brew shellenv ` in my config in order to make this work in my setup.
Thanks for your help.  I can make it work now.

Had the same issue as @deweller...the change that was done recently to Library/Homebrew/cmd/shellenv.sh doesn't allow me to reload the shell (i.e: with `exec $SHELL`) anymore as my PATH will lose the homebrew paths.

It can be easily fixed adding `unset HOMEBREW_SHELLENV_PREFIX && /opt/homebrew/bin/brew shellenv` as Devon mentions in his last comment, but I think it might be a problem that the post-installation instructions don't mention that "fix" for that kind of special cases.
I don't quite follow -- why does `exec $SHELL` retain `HOMEBREW_SHELLENV_PREFIX` but reset your `PATH`?

Ok, I see it's a problem when `PATH` is setup.

One simple `.zshrc` to reproduce the issue:

```
PATH="/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/local/go/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin"

eval "$(/opt/homebrew/bin/brew shellenv)"
```

So the first load of the shell is ok as `HOMEBREW_SHELLENV_PREFIX` is unset, but followings ones gets only .zshrc PATH as `HOMEBREW_SHELLENV_PREFIX` is set.

Well, I guess if someone is playing with the PATH on their config they will know how to fix the problem (or find this github issue), so please forget my comments about the post-installation instructions :)

issue.title: brew broken in tmux from shellenv

labels.name: outdated
labels.description: PR was locked due to age

repository.name: brew
repository.description: ðŸº The missing package manager for macOS (or Linux)

issue.body:
### `brew config` output

```shell
HOMEBREW_VERSION: 3.2.7
ORIGIN: https://github.com/Homebrew/brew
HEAD: 0e63fb8200d54e365cfb20eb8c7a98620b23b42f
Last commit: 5 days ago
Core tap ORIGIN: https://github.com/Homebrew/linuxbrew-core
Core tap HEAD: c4568afa9224efb2a343c40f8cd00366c1512227
Core tap last commit: 26 hours ago
Core tap branch: master
HOMEBREW_PREFIX: /home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew
HOMEBREW_CASK_OPTS: []
HOMEBREW_DISPLAY: :0
HOMEBREW_EDITOR: vim
HOMEBREW_MAKE_JOBS: 8
Homebrew Ruby: 2.6.3 => /home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/Homebrew/Library/Homebrew/vendor/portable-ruby/2.6.3_2/bin/ruby
CPU: octa-core 64-bit skylake
Clang: 12.0.1 build (parse error)
Git: 2.32.0 => /home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/bin/git
Curl: 7.68.0 => /usr/bin/curl
Kernel: Linux 5.11.0-27-generic x86_64 GNU/Linux
OS: Ubuntu 20.04.2 LTS (focal)
Host glibc: 2.31
/usr/bin/gcc: 9.3.0
/usr/bin/ruby: 2.7.0
glibc: N/A
gcc@5: 5.5.0_7
xorg: N/A
```


### `brew doctor` output

```shell
Please note that these warnings are just used to help the Homebrew maintainers
with debugging if you file an issue. If everything you use Homebrew for is
working fine: please don't worry or file an issue; just ignore this. Thanks!

Warning: Some installed kegs have no formulae!
This means they were either deleted or installed with `brew diy`.
You should find replacements for the following formulae:
  libva-internal

Warning: Some installed formulae are deprecated or disabled.
You should find replacements for the following formulae:
  isl@0.18

Warning: "config" scripts exist outside your system or Homebrew directories.
`./configure` scripts often look for *-config scripts to determine if
software packages are installed, and which additional flags to use when
compiling and linking.

Having additional scripts in your path can confuse software installed via
Homebrew if the config script overrides a system or Homebrew-provided
script of the same name. We found the following "config" scripts:
  //home/ANT.AMAZON.COM/rothgar/.cargo/bin/cargo-install-update-config

Warning: You have unlinked kegs in your Cellar.
Leaving kegs unlinked can lead to build-trouble and cause formulae that depend on
those kegs to fail to run properly once built. Run `brew link` on these:
  libvdpau
  six
Warning: Use wayland instead of deprecated linuxbrew/xorg/wayland
Warning: Use libvdpau instead of deprecated linuxbrew/xorg/libvdpau
Warning: Use wayland-protocols instead of deprecated linuxbrew/xorg/wayland-protocols
Warning: Use wayland instead of deprecated linuxbrew/xorg/wayland
```


### 

- [X] I ran `brew update` and am still able to reproduce my issue.
- [X] I have resolved all warnings from `brew doctor` and that did not fix my problem.

### What were you trying to do (and why)?

Open a terminal and then start a tmux session.

### What happened (include all command output)?

The initial terminal works but the tmux session does not have brew available or any brew commands in path

It appears to be related to #11789
If I unset `HOMEBREW_SHELLENV_PREFIX` in my zshrc then the shellenv command works and brew is available inside tmux.

![homebrew](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/371796/129987351-48b59a26-3957-4d46-a7c7-a38ffa930393.gif)


### What did you expect to happen?

Ability to still run brew inside a tmux session.


### Step-by-step reproduction instructions (by running `brew` commands)

```shell
Please see attached gif.

1. open a terminal
1. open tmux

It works if I
1. open a terminal
1. `unset HOMEBREW_SHELLENV_PREFIX` inside .zshrc
1. open tmux
```
